20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.title: Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence
20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.description:
In this week’s episode of The Learning Curve, co-hosts Alisha Searcy and Massachusetts civics teacher Kelley Brown interview Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jack Rakove, Coe Professor Emeritus at Stanford University. Prof. Rakove explores the origins of the American Revolution and U.S. Constitution through the lives of the nation’s Founding Era figures. Reflecting on young John Adams’ vivid depiction of his schoolhouse in colonial Massachusetts, Rakove offers context for the political and social landscape of the 18th-century America.

The post Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

9b31969d1b902df8f3a559e5da0ba6b586b10920.description:
Iowa’s reliance on federal funds flowing through our state—which cumulatively exceed the $9.4 billion state General Fund—reveals a growing imbalance that puts Iowa at risk. 95b5efe8383a08071bde2fef2271171f2b64c9f7.title: Despite Statewide Legalization, Boston has a lot of Work to Do to Allow By-Right ADUs Within Its Borders
95b5efe8383a08071bde2fef2271171f2b64c9f7.description:
This edition of The House Call explains why the City of Boston is behind the curve on broadly allowing accessory dwelling units by right, and what it's doing to catch up. The newsletter also explores the (limited) housing options for seasonal workers on Cape Cod and how some employers are housing workers in company-owned buildings.

The post Despite Statewide Legalization, Boston has a lot of Work to Do to Allow By-Right ADUs Within Its Borders appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.title: DOGE Taskforce Targets Red Tape in Iowa Government
9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.description:
The DOGE Taskforce’s recommendations stem from three specialized committees: Workforce Improvement, Technology, and Return on Taxpayer Investment. The Workforce Committee is focused on expanding apprenticeship and internship programs in partnership with businesses and community colleges. Meanwhile, the Technology Committee is exploring the creation of a single, user-friendly portal where Iowans can renew licenses, pay fees, and even register to vote.

The taskforce has also proposed establishing a “Red Tape Hotline”—a unified online portal and call line where businesses, educators, and job seekers can report bureaucratic obstacles in real time. This innovation could help both state and local governments identify and eliminate unnecessary regulatory burden.

The post DOGE Taskforce Targets Red Tape in Iowa Government appeared first on ITR Foundation.
